title: Textile, 1900–69
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: wax resist dyeing (batik) on plain weave
description: Length of batik divided into three sections: two end sections patterned by loose all-over floral vine; and the middle section by a mirror repeat of triangles ("tumpal" motif) and two floral borders. The pattern is dark red on ivory ground. Two or four edges have borders.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, 1900–69.Medium: cotton
Technique: wax resist dyeing (batik) on plain weave. Gift of Alan L. Wolfe. 1969-50-13.
